definition: to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
(of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)

sentences.english: What the little boys didn't know was that a second train was heading straight for them.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火車正朝他們駛過來，兩個小男孩卻渾然不知。

sentences.english: The Car km operated of bus operators refers to pay km.
sentences.chinese: 巴士營辦商的車輛行駛里數爲收費里數。

sentences.english: We were sailing on starboard tack.
When the driver finally discovered the trolleybus coming towards him through the fog.
sentences.chinese: 當他最後透過霧發現電車向他駛來時。

sentences.english: The ship churned the water up as it passed.
sentences.chinese: 輪船駛過時，把水攪得波浪翻滾。

sentences.english: The winds were contrary;we had to beat about for two days.
sentences.chinese: 正碰上逆風，我們的船隻好迎斜風行駛了兩天。

sentences.english: The whole house jarred when a truck passed by.
sentences.chinese: 當一輛卡車駛過時，整座房屋都震動起來。

sentences.english: Was the Vehicle driven or towed from the scene of Accident ?
sentences.chinese: 受保車輛是否自行駛離或被拖離現場？

sentences.english: She heard the carriage drive away as she proceeded up stairs.
sentences.chinese: 她上樓的時候，聽到馬車駛走的聲音。

sentences.english: Drives always drove into the hole，but they never drove out.
sentences.chinese: 司機們總是駛進洞中，而且從他們沒有駛出來。

sentences.english: Two individuals jumped into a doorway as a police tactical aid unit drove past.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個人在警方戰術增援部隊駛過時竄入一扇門中。

sentences.english: The carriage rolled briskly through the long streets into the smoky downtown district.
sentences.chinese: 馬車匆匆駛過長杳的街道，進入煙塵瀰漫的市中區。

sentences.english: A truck came grinding up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 一輛卡車嘎嘎響地慢慢駛上山。

sentences.english: The wind is too strong, we shall have to luff up.
sentences.chinese: 風太大了，我們得搶風行駛。

definition: to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
